intro: Pilosella xanthostigma, commonly known as the yellow-haired groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely hairy stems and leaves, with small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Pilosella xanthostigma is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
